availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. White (Henry County, Kentucky, carpenter.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Susan M. White. Father of Charles O. White, Mary E. White, Zachary T. White, Sally R. White, Edward B. White, and William H. White. Cabinet maker in Henry County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Henry County in 1850. Master carpenter in Henry County in 1860. Employed John Hailman as carpenter in 1860. Postmaster in Gratz, Owen County from April 28, 1863 to April 20, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 366A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 586.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 305.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p. 365 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
